        public GKDriver(java.lang.String confFile,
                int uid,

        Constructor class, creates the object given the configuration file path.

        Parameters:
        confFile - Path to the driver configuration file
        uid - gatekeeper user-id
        pass - gatekeeper account password

    • Method Detail

      • getUserList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getUserList(int attemptCount)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This function gets the list of registered users with Gatekeeper.

        Parameters:
        attemptCount - int value that allows internal attempts to fulfill the request. Should be a value between 0 and 4
        Returns:
        list of registered users as string ArrayList object, on error a null is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an Exception is raised and must be caught or processed

      • simpleAuthentication

        public boolean simpleAuthentication(int userId,
                                    java.lang.String password)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Allows simple authentication process.

        Parameters:
        userId - int value representing the user-id
        password - string value representing user's password
        Returns:
        true if authentication is successfull, else false is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • generateToken

        public java.lang.String generateToken(int userId,
                                      java.lang.String password)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Method to generate a valid token given an userId and corresponding password.

        Parameters:
        userId - the user's id
        password - the user's password
        Returns:
        the token as String, if authentication fails a null is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • registerUser

        public int registerUser(java.lang.String username,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        boolean isAdmin,
                        java.lang.String accessList,
                        int attemptCount)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows registration of a new user with Gatekeeper service. This is an admin-only call.

        Parameters:
        username - the desired username
        password - the account password associated with this user
        isAdmin - true if user is an admin-user, else false
        accessList - comma separated list of resources/services this user has access to, use ALL to grant access to everything
        attemptCount - integer value controlling the self execution iterations, should be a value between 0 and 4
        Returns:
        the user-id as integer if registration is successful, -1 if the process fails.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • deleteUser

        public boolean deleteUser(int userId,
                          int attemptCount)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows an admin user to delete an user identified by user-id

        Parameters:
        userId - the user's id whose account is to be deleted from Gatekeeper
        attemptCount - integer value controlling the self execution iterations, should be a value between 0 and 4
        Returns:
        true if the account was successfully deleted, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isAdmin

        public boolean isAdmin(int userId,
                       int attemptCount)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows an admin user to check if another user is admin or not

        Parameters:
        userId - the user's id whose account is to be checked as admin from Gatekeeper
        attemptCount - integer value controlling the self execution iterations, should be a value between 0 and 4
        Returns:
        true if the account is an admin, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • validateToken

        public boolean validateToken(java.lang.String token,
                             int userId)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows validation of a token against an user-id, if token is valid and belongs to a claimed user the response is true, else false.

        Parameters:
        token - The token which needs to be validated
        userId - user-id to be validated with
        Returns:
        true if the validation is successful, else a false is returned
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • validateToken

        public boolean validateToken(java.lang.String token,
                             java.lang.String serviceKey)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This method check the token for authorization to use a particular service, if the token is valid, and the user associated with this token has access rights to the service - the respose is true, otherwise a false is returned.

        Parameters:
        token - The token which needs to be validated
        serviceKey - The service-key of the service which is requesting the validation of this token
        Returns:
        true if the user associated with token has access to this service provided the token is valid, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • updatePassword

        public boolean updatePassword(java.lang.String userId,
                              java.lang.String password,
                              java.lang.String token)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows the user to update their own password.

        Parameters:
        token - The token which needs to be validated
        userId - The userId of the account
        Returns:
        true if the password was updated successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getServiceList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getServiceList(int attemptCount)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This admin only method allows admins to get the list of registered services with Gatekeeper. The return array contains service-short-name,service-key as its elements.

        Parameters:
        attemptCount - integer value controlling the self execution iterations, should be a value between 0 and 4
        Returns:
        list of registered services as string ArrayList object, each element as name,key,id tuple, on error a null is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • registerService

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> registerService(java.lang.String shortName,
                                                                            java.lang.String description,
                                                                            int attemptCount)
                                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This method allows an admin user to register a new service with Gatekeeper, what is returned is a service-uri and service-key. The key should be made available to the service itself for authorizing access to its service, the uri can be stored by admin to manipulate this service representation in Gatekeeper later on.

        Parameters:
        shortName - a unique short-name (one-word) for this service being registered, this short-name can be used in the access-list of users granting then access to this service.
        description - a sentence describing this service.
        attemptCount - integer value controlling the self execution iterations, should be a value between 0 and 4
        Returns:
        a HashMap object containing the service uri and the key. null is returned in case of error.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
